Class! I'm partial to humour a la Gintama, and I'm
glad to see that it's going out to a wider
(English-speaking) audience. Gin-san reminds me a bit
of Kenshin (both have dark pasts) but in my opinion,
he is much more fun (ducks flying objects from Kenshin
fans). 
And Okita and Kagura are great characters. Y'know if I
was a bit more obsessive, I'd petition Sorachi to
introduce Saitou Hajime. 

Mio. 

--- guuchan <jungleguuchan@...> wrote:


---------------------------------
Gintama - A Shounen jump title which features an AU
Bakamatsu universe replete with Aliens has apparently
been picked up by Viz, and will be released in English
at a to be announced date.

Actually, I quite like the manga -- even though it
probably is a bit irreverent in its treatment of
history. I find the characterizations of the
Shinsengumi and the Ishin to be inspired, although not
exactly serious.  The names aren't quite the same, but
you'll easily recognize Kondou, Hijikata, Okita,
Yamazaki and from the Ishin: Sakamoto, Katsura and
Takasugi.

This is the only English fansite that I am aware of at
the moment: http://www.yorozuya.cjb.net/ 

Yes there are (were) scanslations, but I suspect these
will be yanked out of deference to Viz.  

-S
